parties.raw_snippet: TRANSFER AND SERVICING AGREEMENT, dated as of January 29, 2020 (this "Agreement"), among VERIZON OWNER TRUST 2020-A, a Delaware statutory trust, as issuer (the "Issuer"), VERIZON ABS LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as depositor (the "Depositor"), and Cellco Partnership d/b/a Verizon Wireless, a Delaware general partnership ("Cellco"), as servicer (in such capacity, the "Servicer"), as marketing agent (in such capacity, the "Marketing Agent") and as custodian (in such capacity, the "Custodian").
parties.reasoning: The parties are identified in the opening paragraph of the agreement, listing the three entities entering into this Transfer and Servicing Agreement.

contract_type.raw_snippet: TRANSFER AND SERVICING AGREEMENT, dated as of January 29, 2020 (this "Agreement"), among VERIZON OWNER TRUST 2020-A, a Delaware statutory trust, as issuer (the "Issuer"), VERIZON ABS LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as depositor (the "Depositor"), and Cellco Partnership d/b/a Verizon Wireless, a Delaware general partnership ("Cellco"), as servicer (in such capacity, the "Servicer"), as marketing agent (in such capacity, the "Marketing Agent") and as custodian (in such capacity, the "Custodian"). ... In connection with a securitization transaction sponsored by Cellco in which the Issuer will issue Notes secured by a pool of Receivables consisting of device payment plan agreements, certain of the Originators and/or the Master Trust have transferred a pool of Receivables and related property, and any of the Originators and/or the Master Trust may from time to time transfer additional pools of Receivables and related property to the Depositor, who will transfer them to the Issuer. The Issuer will engage the Servicer to service the Receivables.
contract_type.reasoning: This is a securitization agreement where the Depositor transfers receivables to the Issuer, and Cellco is engaged to service those receivables. The primary economic substance involves the servicing of receivables for an asset-backed securities transaction. The servicer is being engaged to manage, service, administer and collect on receivables. This is fundamentally a service agreement where Cellco provides servicing, custodian, and marketing agent services for the securitization structure.

notice_period.reasoning: This agreement does not contain a renewal provision or a notice period to terminate renewal. The agreement has a specific termination structure tied to the Amortization Period and Final Maturity Date, with optional redemption provisions. There is no automatic renewal mechanism that requires advance notice to prevent renewal. Section 8.3 states termination occurs when receivables are paid in full or the Issuer is terminated under the Trust Agreement, but there is no notice period to prevent renewal.

expiration_date.raw_snippet: "Final Maturity Date" means, for (i) the Class A-1a Notes, the Payment Date in July, 2024, (ii) the Class A-1b Notes, the Payment Date in July, 2024, (iii) the Class B Notes, the Payment Date in July, 2024, and (iv) the Class C Notes, the Payment Date in July, 2024.
expiration_date.reasoning: The agreement defines the Final Maturity Date for all classes of Notes as the Payment Date in July 2024. While the agreement may technically continue until all receivables are settled per Section 8.3, the substantive obligations related to the Notes expire on the Final Maturity Date. The Payment Date is defined as the 20th day of each month, so this would be July 20, 2024.

renewal_term.reasoning: This agreement does not contain any automatic renewal provisions. Section 8.3 states that the agreement terminates on the earlier of (a) when the last receivable is paid in full, settled, sold or written off, or (b) when the Issuer is terminated under the Trust Agreement. There are optional redemption provisions in Sections 8.1 and 8.2, but no renewal term. This is a securitization agreement tied to specific notes with a Final Maturity Date, not a contract that renews for successive terms.
